title: England medics to closely monitor Marcus Rashford's fitness ahead of Czech Republic clash
text:
England medics will closely monitor Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford’s fitness ahead of the Euro 2020 clash against Czech Republic.

The forward is ready to declare himself fully fit for the game in Prague on Friday after reporting for international duty at St George’s Park on Monday.

The United star has established himself as an England starter in recent months, but the emergence of Borussia Dortmund winger Jadon Sancho has put his place under serious threat.

England medics will monitor Marcus Rashford's fitness ahead of the clash with Czech Republic

Rashford suffered a groin injury in the Premier League defeat against West Ham on September 22, which raised fears he could miss the clash in the Czech capital and Monday’s visit to Bulgaria.

But the 21-year-old returned to action last Monday when he started against Arsenal and has featured in United’s previous two games.

Rashford completed an indoor session at St George’s Park on Monday but is due to commence full training on Tuesday.

Rashford, pictured with Harry Maguire, completed an indoor session on Monday but is expected to start full training on Tuesday

Gareth Southgate’s staff will pay particular attention to Rashford’s fitness before deciding on the starting XI to face the Czech Republic so not to risk a recurrence of the groin problem.

Sancho will be waiting in the wings to start the clash in Prague if there are any lingering doubts over Rashford’s fitness going into the qualifier.

The former Manchester City star started in England’s previous clash qualifier against Kosovo, scoring twice in a 5-3 win and is applying real pressure on Rashford to play alongside Harry Kane and Raheem Sterling in Southgate’s front three.

Everton midfielder Fabian Delph has withdrawn from the squad with a hamstring injury.
